text:
In Ant 1.4.1, the keystore attribute to the signjar could be a URL, however, in
1.5, this ability has been removed.  We were using this feature to sign jar
files for signing release builds generically amongst platforms.  Is there a
reason it has been removed?
creator: etheriau@accis.edu

text:
What he said.  The fact that this doesn't work is *really* annoying and forces
me to have to exec the JDK jarsigner, which is sort of silly.
creator: tara@bluemartini.com

text:
Okay, we had a look at the code.  It appears at some point somebody went through
and changed all the input attributes for the signjar task from strings to file
objects, which seems a likely culprit for the weird behavior we're seeing. 
We're going to pull source and rebuild with it switched back to a string to see
if that fixes the problem.
creator: tara@bluemartini.com
conor@apache.org
text:
This has been reverted to a string. The behaviour is not quite like 1.4.1 in
that the code will attempt to resolve the string a s a file relative to the
project's basedir. If the resulting file does not exist, it is assumed to be a
URL and passed directly. Hopefully this is the best of both worlds.

I'm marking this as targetted for 1.6 for now but it may be merged into 1.5.2 if
time permits.
